subject: Programming
title: Deliberate Practice in Programming
description: A micro-lesson that makes Deliberate Practice in Programming usable.

hook.text: Writing code for ten years doesn't make you an expert. Practicing the right things does.

buildup.text: Deliberate practice means targeting weaknesses with focused exercises just beyond your comfort zone.

discovery.text: Code katas, algorithmic challenges, and studying others' code are forms of deliberate practice.

twist.text: Most developers never practice deliberately. They repeat comfortable patterns and stop growing.

climax.text: The gap between a good and great developer often comes down to whether they practice outside of work.

punchline.text: Practice at the edge of your ability. That's where growth lives.

quiz.question: What distinguishes deliberate practice from regular coding?
options: It targets weaknesses with focused exercises
It requires no effort or challenge
